definition: most outstanding/par excellence
alone/independent/single/sole/only
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: During Xia, Shang and Zhou dynasties, Central Plains lay the core of Chinese civilization.
sentences.chinese: 夏商周三代文明，中原独领风骚，居于全国中枢地位。

sentences.english: Luxury brands do well in the performance and design categories.
sentences.chinese: 豪华车在性能和设计领域独领风骚。

sentences.english: The days of three-button dominance are over.
sentences.chinese: 现在，“三扣“独领风骚的时代已经一去不复返了。

definition: to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
person of outstanding talent
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
(acknowledged) place/a role to play/niche
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to be renowned
great heroes pursue deer in the central plains (idiom); fig. many vie for supremacy
to come forth in large numbers
unfailing/never-ending
to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
